boardgame.name: The Third World War
boardgame.description: The Third World War: Battle for Germany:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Third World War (subtitled Battle for Germany) is a game of the struggle for central Europe by the forces of NATO and the Warsaw Pact. The divisions and independent regiments and brigades of fifteen nations battle in multi-impulse turns that feature NATO reserve movement and Pact echeloning. Air units represent groups of 100 aircraft of a specific type, each rated for air superiority, close support and strike capability._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The maps, scaled at 45 kilometers per hex, cover all of Germany and the surrounding area from Denmark to Yugoslavia and Italy, from France to Poland. Other games in this Third World War series, featuring constant scale and mateable maps, include Scandinavia (Arctic Front), the Balkans (Southern Front), and the Persian Gulf (Persian Gulf: Battle for the Middle East)._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 1984 Charles S. Roberts Best Twentieth Century Game Nominee

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: This game was a preorder.

Please do not buy this game if you are looking for a ready to play out of the box copy. Unit ID and Errata sheets are not there. I can provide copies. 80 Markers are missing. If you have other copies of games in the series, they are interchanagable. The neutral reaction chits are there, which is good, as they are critical to the game. 6 units are missing. 4 are the replacements for Southern Front. 2 are WP air units. These can be readily recreated with the blanks and information on the geek. Everything else is there. Counters have been sorted and are in 16 baggies (GMT size). Die, rules, four charts, maps, two empty counter trees, die. Box is in good condition, top left is creased about 2_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;, structurally intact, no splits but wear is seen. This is for all 4 games in the TWW Series: The Third World War: Battle for Germany, Southern Front, Arctic Front, and Persian Gulf. All games have been punched and played by someone who took good care of his games, and range from Good to Very Good condition. All four boxes are here; they all show normal shelf wear, and are completely intact – no split corners or tape. Maps are all in Good or better condition, corners look to have been taped for joining, but there are no tears or sticky residue. In most cases the tape has been folded over the corners of the individual maps. Counters have been neatly cut, and in some cases (the first three games) they are corner clipped. Counters show no excessive wear. All of the rules and charts are here, a couple show some normal handling wear. Rules have been highlighted neatly, and sparingly. The Third World War: BfG, Southern Front, and Arctic Front, were acquired as a three game set and the counters have been combined in two counter trays, by NATO v Warsaw Pact. Persian Gulf was acquired separately, to complete the set, and is complete unto itself. This is a great opportunity to acquire this very playable series, and actually play it, instead of wondering if you should punch out the counters of a pristine copy. I will insure the package, if requested, for an additional $5 S_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;H of $12 is for US addresses only. I am willing to ship worldwide if you are willing to pay the international shipping charges.
